hero.projectTagline: Take control of your finances without stress

theProblem.title: The Problem
theProblem.text: Personal finance apps often fall into two extremes: they’re either dull, unattractive, and overwhelming, or so simple they become ineffective. As a result, users quickly abandon them because managing expenses feels more like a punishment than a healthy habit.

researchAndLearnings.title: Research & Insights
researchAndLearnings.text: By analyzing existing apps and listening to young, digital-savvy users, I identified three key needs:

items.label: Speed:
items.text: “I want to log an expense in seconds.”

items.label: Clarity:
items.text: “I need to see my balance without digging through menus.”

items.label: Style:
items.text: “The app should feel modern, not like a disguised spreadsheet.”

theIdea.title: The Idea
theIdea.text: CentoApp was born as a design concept aimed at solving this challenge: a financial experience that is clear, engaging, and so fast to use that logging an expense feels as natural as sending a message.

designSolution.title: The Design Solution
features: Optimized flow: reduced from 5 steps to just 2 to log an expense.
Two usage modes: quick (daily) and advanced (analytical).
Floating shortcuts: log income/expense with a single tap.
Visual dashboard: clear balance and simple graphs.
Dark mode: designed for nighttime comfort.

learnings.title: What I Learned
items: Perceived speed matters more than feature quantity.
Separating quick and advanced modes reduces cognitive load.
Immediate visual feedback builds trust and motivates users.
